page.title: 10Industry around Two Bridges
page.content:
In the area there is a disused quarry very near Two Bridges, although it is of little significance, but may have been utilised in the construction of the Devonport Leat.
There are several hut circles and settlements in the area, but again they are not of especial interest. They date from the Bronze Age and the Iron Age. The largest settlement is to be found on the slopes of Longford Tor.
There are the remains of about six buildings at the old gunpowder mills clustered around their own small leat taken from the small Cherry Brook.
